In this page, I reported my package collection ispired by the following posts:

* [Quick list of useful R packages](https://support.rstudio.com/hc/en-us/articles/201057987-Quick-list-of-useful-R-packages?mobile_site=true)
* [Great R packages for data import, wrangling and visualization](https://www.computerworld.com/article/2921176/business-intelligence/great-r-packages-for-data-import-wrangling-visualization.html#tk.drr_mlt)
* [R resources (free courses, books, tutorials, & cheat sheets)](https://paulvanderlaken.com/2017/08/10/r-resources-cheatsheets-tutorials-books/)
* [Top 20 R Libraries for Data Science in 2018 ](https://activewizards.com/blog/top-20-r-libraries-for-data-science-in-2018-infographic/)
* [Data Science Links](http://jasdumas.com/ds-resources/)

# Get the data

This [manual](https://cran.r-project.org/doc/manuals/r-release/R-data.html)  describes the import and export facilities available either in R itself or via packages which are available from CRAN or elsewhere.  

> readr

the goal of `readr` is to provide a fast and friendly way to read rectangular data. 
[readr - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/readr/vignettes/readr.html)

> rio

The idea behind rio is to simplify the process of importing data into R and exporting data from R. 

[rio - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/rio/vignettes/rio.html)

> dplyr

`dplyr` is a grammar of data manipulation, providing a consistent set of verbs that help you solve the most common data manipulation challenges

[dbplyr - website](https://dplyr.tidyverse.org/)

[dbplyr - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/dbplyr/vignettes/dbplyr.html)

> MonetDBLite

MonetDBLite for R, a fully embedded version of MonetDB that installs like any other R package.



# Data Trasformation

> forcats

The goal of the forcats package is to provide a suite of useful tools that solve common problems with factors.

[forcats - website](http://forcats.tidyverse.org/)



# Explorative data analysis


> SmartEDA

Summarize and Explore the Data 

[SmartEDA - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/SmartEDA/vignettes/Report_r1.html)

> FunModeling

`funModeling`: data cleaning, importance variable analysis and model perfomance

[funModeling - github](funModeling)

> DataExplorer

Data exploration process for data analysis and model building, so that users could focus on understanding data and extracting insights. The package automatically scans through each variable and does data profiling. 

[DataExplorer - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/DataExplorer/vignettes/dataexplorer-intro.html)


> naniar

`naniar` provides data structures and functions that facilitate the plotting of missing values and examination of imputations.

[naniar - website](http://naniar.njtierney.com/articles/naniar-visualisation.html)
[naniar - github](https://github.com/njtierney/naniar)


# Dimension Reduction (PCA)

> FactoMineR

`FactoMineR` is an R package dedicated to multivariate Exploratory Data Analysis.

[FactoMineR - website](http://factominer.free.fr/)

# Clustering

> fpc

Various methods for clustering and cluster validation.



> gower

Gower’s distance can be used to measure how different two records are.

[gower - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/gower/vignettes/intro.html)

# Visualization

> ggplot2

`ggplot2` is a system for declaratively creating graphics, based on The Grammar of Graphics.

[ggplot2 - website](http://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/)

> GGally

`GGally` extends ggplot2 by adding several functions to reduce the complexity of combining geoms with transformed data.

[GGally - website](https://ggobi.github.io/ggally/)

> ggpubr

The `ggpubr` package provides some easy-to-use functions for creating and customizing ‘ggplot2’- based publication ready plots.

[ggpubr - sthda website](http://www.sthda.com/english/rpkgs/ggpubr/index.html)

> ggrepel

Repel overlapping text labels away from each other

[ggrepel - vignettes](https://github.com/slowkow/ggrepel)

> tabplot

The tableplot is a powerful visualization method to explore and analyse large multivariate datasets

[tabplot - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tabplot/vignettes/tabplot-vignette.html)

> ggstatsplot

creates graphics with details from statistical tests
[ggstatsplot - github](https://github.com/IndrajeetPatil/ggstatsplot)

> plotly

An R package for creating interactive web graphics.

[plotly - github](https://github.com/ropensci/plotly)

> patchwork

The goal of `patchwork` is to make it ridiculously simple to combine separate ggplots into the same graphic. 
[patchwork - github](https://github.com/thomasp85/patchwork/blob/master/README.md) 

> factoextra

`factoextra` is an R package making easy to extract and visualize the output of exploratory multivariate data analyses

[factoextra - sthda website](http://www.sthda.com/english/wiki/factoextra-r-package-easy-multivariate-data-analyses-and-elegant-visualization)

> ggiraphExtra

`ggiraphExtra` contains many useful functions for exploratoty plots.

[ggiraphExtra - vignettes](http://rpubs.com/cardiomoon/231820)

# Machine Learning


> caret

The `caret` package (short for Classification And REgression Training) contains functions to streamline the model training process for complex regression and classification problems.
[caret - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/caret/vignettes/caret.html)

> mlr

`mlr` is a framework for machine learning experiments in R.
[mlr - website](https://mlr-org.github.io/mlr-tutorial/release/html/index.html)
[mlr - blog](https://mlr-org.github.io/)

> Metrics

An R package for common supervised machine learning metrics 
[Metrics - github](https://github.com/mfrasco/Metrics)


> iml

The `iml` package provides tools for analysing any black box machine learning model.
[iml - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/iml/vignettes/intro.html)

> lime

The purpose of `lime` is to explain the predictions of black box classifiers
[lime - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lime/vignettes/Understanding_lime.html)
[lime - github](https://github.com/thomasp85/lime)

> xgboostExplaine

An R package that makes xgboost models fully interpretable
[xgboostExplainer - tutorial](https://medium.com/applied-data-science/new-r-package-the-xgboost-explainer-51dd7d1aa211) 


> shinyMlr

Integration of the mlr package into shiny.
With help of this package mlr can be accessed via a shiny interface.

[shinyMlr - github](https://github.com/mlr-org/shinyMlr)
[shinyMlr - video tutorial](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VZuRSQZdayY&list=PLcTJ-34ghaH2QGL73DWfQvIdacW01Nvtp)

> bounceR

`bounceR` provides methods and tools for automated feature selection for Machine Learning models. The methods are fit for situation in which the data scientists faces an exceedingly high number of features.

[bounceR - github](https://github.com/STATWORX/bounceR) )

> recipes

`recipes` is an alternative method for creating and preprocessing design matrices that can be used for modeling or visualization.
[recipes - github](https://github.com/topepo/recipes)

> modelDown

`modelDown` generates a website with HTML summaries for predictive models 
[modelDown - vignettes](modelDown generates a website with HTML summaries for predictive models)

# Time series

> tsfknn

The package allows, with only a function, to specify the KNN model and to generate the forecasts. 
[tsfknn - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tsfknn/vignettes/tsfknn.html)

> prophet

Prophet is a procedure for forecasting time series data based on an additive model where non-linear trends are fit with yearly, weekly, and daily seasonality, plus holiday effects.
[prohet - website](https://facebook.github.io/prophet/) 

# R Interface

> sparkryl

`sparklyr` is an R interface for Apache Spark

[sparklyr - website](http://spark.rstudio.com/)


> RWeka

An R interface to Weka. Weka is a collection of machine learning algorithms for data mining tasks written in Java.

> rbokeh

rbokeh is an R Interface for Bokeh. Bokeh is a visualization library that provides a flexible and powerful declarative framework for creating web-based plots
[rbokeh - vignettes ](http://hafen.github.io/rbokeh/#background)


## Deep Learning interface

> h2o

R scripting functionality for 'H2O', the open source math engine for big data that computes parallel distributed machine learning algorithms such as generalized linear models, gradient boosting machines, random forests, and neural networks (deep learning) within various cluster environments.

[h2o - website](http://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-r/docs/index.html)


[h2o - tutorial](https://github.com/h2oai/h2o-tutorials/tree/master/tutorials/deeplearning)


> Keras

R interface to Keras
[keras - website](https://tensorflow.rstudio.com/keras/)


# Big-Data

> ff

The ff package provides data structures that are stored on disk but behave (almost) as if they were in RAM.
[ff - website](http://ff.r-forge.r-project.org/)

> replyr

The `replyr` package attempts to provide practical data manipulation affordances to make code perform similarly on local or remote (big) data.
[replyr - github](https://github.com/WinVector/replyr)



# Deploy

> aurelius

Provides tools for converting R objects and syntax into the Portable Format for Analytics (PFA). 

[aurelius - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/aurelius/vignettes/basic-usage.html)


# Shiny

> shiny

`shiny` makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R
[shiny - website](https://shiny.rstudio.com/)

> shinydashboard

`shinydashboard` makes it easy to use Shiny to create dashboards
[shinydashboard - website](https://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/)

> shinyproxy

ShinyProxy is your favourite way to deploy Shiny apps in an enterprise context.
[shinyproxy - website](https://www.shinyproxy.io/#what-is-shinyproxy)

> shinyLP

A R package for Bootstrap Components to make Landing Home Pages for Shiny
[shinyLP - github](https://github.com/jasdumas/shinyLP)

> shinytemplate

RStudio Project Templates for Shinyapps
[shinytemplate - github](https://github.com/ThinkR-open/shinytemplate)

> shinymodule

A Shiny module is a piece of a Shiny app.
[shinymodules - shiny website](https://shiny.rstudio.com/articles/modules.html)

> dashboardthemes

custom theme support for R Shinydashboard applications
[ dashboardthemes - github](https://github.com/nik01010/dashboardthemes)

# Reporting & Publishing results

> rmarkdorwn

Convert R Markdown documents into a variety of formats.

[rmarkdown - website](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/)

> icon

web icons for rmarkdown

[icon - website](https://ropensci.org/technotes/2018/05/15/icon/)

> officer

Access and manipulate 'Microsoft Word' and 'Microsoft PowerPoint' documents from R. 
[officer - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/officer/vignettes/officer_reader.html)

> kableExtra

The goal of kableExtra is to help you build common complex tables and manipulate table styles.

[kableExtra - website](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/kableExtra/vignettes/awesome_table_in_html.html)

> slidex

slidex is aimed at making the process of converting Microsoft PowerPoint slides to beautiful HTML xaringan slides as seamless as possible, maintaining tables,figures, links, and bulleted lists.
[slidex - github](https://github.com/datalorax/slidex)

# Quality Control

> SixSigma

Functions and utilities to perform Statistical Analyses in the Six Sigma way.

[SixSigma with R - ebook website](http://www.sixsigmawithr.com/)
[Quality Control with R - ebook](http://www.qualitycontrolwithr.com/)


> qcc

qcc is a contributed R package for statistical quality control charts

[qcc - vignettes](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/qcc/vignettes/qcc_a_quick_tour.html)


# R API

> dockerfiler

dockerfiler is a package that comes with a simple, object oriented API for Dockerfile creation, straight from your R session.

[tutorial](http://colinfay.me/dockerfiler-cran/)

> cloudML

cloudml provides an R interface to Google Cloud Machine Learning Engine
[cloudML - website](https://tensorflow.rstudio.com/tools/cloudml/articles/getting_started.html)


> googleComputeEngineR 


provides an R interface to the Google Cloud Compute Engine API, for launching virtual machines.
[googleComputeEngineR - github](https://github.com/cloudyr/googleComputeEngineR)

# PRoductivity

> packagefinder

With 'packagefinder' you can search for multiple keywords in the name, title and description of the CRAN package, either case-sensitive or insensitive and define your own weighting scheme for the search results, if you like.
[ packagefinder - CRAN](https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/packagefinder/index.html)

# RStudio Addin

> caretTuneGrid

The caretTuneGrid is the RStudio addin for inserting tune parameters code for the caret package. 

[caretTuneGrid - github](https://github.com/milosvil/caretTuneGrid).

> esquisse

RStudio add-in to make plots with ggplot2 

[esquisse - github](https://github.com/dreamRs/esquisse)

> editData

RStudio addin for editing a ‘data.frame’ or a ‘tibble’

[Editing A ‘data.frame’](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/editData/vignettes/editData.html)

> Rcade

The goal of Rcade is to provide access to games in order to waste some times in RStudio. You can play 2048, Tetris, Mario, Pacman, Spider Solitaire and others.

> taskscheduleR

Schedule R scripts/processes with the Windows task scheduler. 

[taskscheduleR - vignettes ](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/taskscheduleR/README.html)
